page.title: 01LANDSCAPE FARMING HABITATION
page.content: This area is predominately open, undulating, good quality farmland. Fields are put to either pasture or cereal growing, the majority being cereals. Sheep and cattle are raised, some milk is produced but lately rearing for meat alone has become an increasing trend. Twelve working farms are located in the area but three work approximately half of all the farmland. The countryside is well wooded along the hedgerows, the principal tree being ash.Some hedgerow removal has taken place but this practice has not yet become extensive and the overall field pattern has largely been maintained. Housing is sparse in the countryside, the principal centres of habitation being the villages of Kibworth Harcourt, Tur Langton and to a smaller extent Shangton.
